skillsSnapshot.prompt:
The following skills provide specialized instructions for specific tasks.
Use the read tool to load a skill's file when the task matches its description.

<available_skills>
  <skill>
    <name>agent-browser</name>
    <description>Headless browser automation CLI optimized for AI agents with accessibility tree snapshots and ref-based element selection</description>
    <location>/home/ubuntu/clawd/skills/agent-browser/SKILL.md</location>
  </skill>
  <skill>
    <name>agent-builder</name>
    <description>Build high-performing OpenClaw agents end-to-end. Use when you want to design a new agent (persona + operating rules) and generate the required OpenClaw workspace files (SOUL.md, IDENTITY.md, AGENTS.md, USER.md, HEARTBEAT.md, optional MEMORY.md + memory/YYYY-MM-DD.md). Also use to iterate on an existing agent’s behavior, guardrails, autonomy model, heartbeat plan, and skill roster.</description>
    <location>/home/ubuntu/clawd/skills/agent-builder/SKILL.md</location>
  </skill>
  <skill>
    <name>auto-updater</name>
    <description>Automatically update Clawdbot and all installed skills once daily. Runs via cron, checks for updates, applies them, and messages the user with a summary of what changed.</description>
    <location>/home/ubuntu/clawd/skills/auto-updater/SKILL.md</location>
  </skill>
  <skill>
    <name>bd-bot</name>
    <description>Business development automation - outbound lead scraping, enrichment, pitch drafting + inbound content scheduling. Use to find AI/full-stack freelance projects and grow personal brand.</description>
    <location>/home/ubuntu/clawd/skills/bd-bot/SKILL.md</location>
  </skill>
  <skill>
    <name>byterover</name>
    <description>Manages project knowledge using ByteRover context tree. Provides two operations: query (retrieve knowledge) and curate (store knowledge). Invoke when user requests information lookup, pattern discovery, or knowledge persistence. Developed by ByteRover Inc. (https://byterover.dev/)</description>
    <location>/home/ubuntu/clawd/skills/byterover/SKILL.md</location>
  </skill>
  <skill>
    <name>clawddocs</name>
    <description>Clawdbot documentation expert with decision tree navigation, search scripts, doc fetching, version tracking, and config snippets for all Clawdbot features</description>
    <location>/home/ubuntu/clawd/skills/clawddocs/SKILL.md</location>
  </skill>
  <skill>
    <name>coding-agent</name>
    <description>Run Kimi CLI, Codex, Claude Code, or other AI coding agents via background process for programmatic control.</description>
    <location>/home/ubuntu/clawd/skills/coding-agent/SKILL.md</location>
  </skill>
  <skill>
    <name>context7</name>
    <description>Fetch up-to-date library documentation via Context7 API. Use PROACTIVELY when:
(1) Working with ANY external library (React, Next.js, Supabase, etc.)
(2) User asks about library APIs, patterns, or best practices
(3) Implementing features that rely on third-party packages
(4) Debugging library-specific issues
(5) Need current documentation beyond training data cutoff
Always prefer this over guessing library APIs or using outdated knowledge.
</description>
    <location>/home/ubuntu/clawd/skills/context7/SKILL.md</location>
  </skill>
  <skill>
    <name>deepwiki</name>
    <description>Query the DeepWiki MCP server for GitHub repository documentation, wiki structure, and AI-powered questions.</description>
    <location>/home/ubuntu/clawd/skills/deepwiki/SKILL.md</location>
  </skill>
  <skill>
    <name>dont-hack-me</name>
    <description>別駭我！基本安全檢測 — Security self-check for OpenClaw (Clawdbot/Moltbot). 14-point audit of your clawdbot.json: exposed gateway, missing auth, open DM policy, weak tokens, file permissions, reverse proxy bypass, Tailscale exposure, directory perms, browser control, log redaction, control UI exposure, mDNS broadcasting. Auto-fix included. Invoke: "run a security check" or "幫我做安全檢查".</description>
    <location>/home/ubuntu/clawd/skills/dont-hack-me/SKILL.md</location>
  </skill>
  <skill>
    <name>firecrawl</name>
    <description>Web scraping and content extraction using Firecrawl API. Scrape single pages, crawl entire domains, or extract specific data from websites. Use when needing clean markdown from web pages, mapping website structure, or extracting structured data without dealing with complex scraping logic.</description>
    <location>/home/ubuntu/clawd/skills/firecrawl/SKILL.md</location>
  </skill>
  <skill>
    <name>google-sheets</name>
    <description>Read, write, and append data to Google Sheets using OAuth 2.0 authentication. Use for logging topics, content ideas, and work tracking — works with organization policies that block service account keys.</description>
    <location>/home/ubuntu/clawd/skills/google-sheets/SKILL.md</location>
  </skill>
  <skill>
    <name>humanizer</name>
    <description>Transform AI-generated text into natural, human-sounding prose. Use when the user wants text rewritten to sound less robotic, more conversational, or with specific personality (casual, professional, enthusiastic, blunt). Triggers include "humanize", "make this sound natural", "rewrite less robotic", "add personality", "casual tone".</description>
    <location>/home/ubuntu/clawd/skills/humanizer/SKILL.md</location>
  </skill>
  <skill>
    <name>knowledge-graph</name>
    <description>Extract entities, relationships, and concepts from conversations to build a persistent graph database of people, projects, technologies, and their connections. Use when identifying key entities in discussions, mapping relationships between concepts, building semantic context, or querying connections between topics.</description>
    <location>/home/ubuntu/clawd/skills/knowledge-graph/SKILL.md</location>
  </skill>
  <skill>
    <name>mcporter</name>
    <description>Use the mcporter CLI to list, configure, auth, and call MCP servers/tools directly (HTTP or stdio), including ad-hoc servers, config edits, and CLI/type generation.</description>
    <location>/home/ubuntu/clawd/skills/mcporter/SKILL.md</location>
  </skill>
  <skill>
    <name>morning-brief</name>
    <description>Personalized morning briefing for Rajesh - weather, tasks, trending content, and productivity tips delivered daily at 9 AM IST</description>
    <location>/home/ubuntu/clawd/skills/morning-brief/SKILL.md</location>
  </skill>
  <skill>
    <name>nano-banana-pro</name>
    <description>Generate/edit images with Nano Banana Pro (Gemini 3 Pro Image). Use for image create/modify requests incl. edits. Supports text-to-image + image-to-image; 1K/2K/4K; use --input-image.</description>
    <location>/home/ubuntu/clawd/skills/nano-banana-pro/SKILL.md</location>
  </skill>
  <skill>
    <name>nano-pdf</name>
    <description>Edit PDFs with natural-language instructions using the nano-pdf CLI.</description>
    <location>/home/ubuntu/clawd/skills/nano-pdf/SKILL.md</location>
  </skill>
  <skill>
    <name>personal-greeting</name>
    <description>Context-aware personal greetings based on time of day, activity patterns, and tasks. Provides morning briefings with tasks and motivation, evening summaries with accomplishments, and weekend suggestions. Use for automated daily check-ins, motivation, and activity tracking integrated with task management.</description>
    <location>/home/ubuntu/clawd/skills/personal-greeting/SKILL.md</location>
  </skill>
  <skill>
    <name>prompt-log</name>
    <description>Extract conversation transcripts from AI coding session logs (Clawdbot, Claude Code, Codex, Kimi). Use when asked to export prompt history, session logs, or transcripts from .jsonl session files.</description>
    <location>/home/ubuntu/clawd/skills/prompt-log/SKILL.md</location>
  </skill>
  <skill>
    <name>reddit-cli</name>
    <description>Reddit CLI using cookies for authentication. Read posts, search, and get subreddit info.</description>
    <location>/home/ubuntu/clawd/skills/reddit-cli/SKILL.md</location>
  </skill>
  <skill>
    <name>steve-diagnostics</name>
    <description>Steve's self-health check - response times, token usage, errors, session bloat. Use when debugging slow responses or checking system health.</description>
    <location>/home/ubuntu/clawd/skills/steve-diagnostics/SKILL.md</location>
  </skill>
  <skill>
    <name>sysadmin-toolbox</name>
    <description>Ready-to-run shell one-liners for common sysadmin tasks including log analysis, process management, network diagnostics, security checks, and AWS CLI operations. Use when needing quick commands for system administration, troubleshooting, monitoring, or AWS management without writing scripts from scratch.</description>
    <location>/home/ubuntu/clawd/skills/sysadmin-toolbox/SKILL.md</location>
  </skill>
  <skill>
    <name>tavily-search</name>
    <description>AI-optimized web search with citations using Tavily API. Search the web with AI-generated summaries and source attribution. Use when needing researched answers with sources, quick fact-checking, or comprehensive topic research without manual browsing.</description>
    <location>/home/ubuntu/clawd/skills/tavily-search/SKILL.md</location>
  </skill>
  <skill>
    <name>ui-formatter</name>
    <description>Transform responses into beautiful Telegram-friendly format with emoji bullets, short lines, clear sections, and mobile-optimized layout. Use when formatting any output for Telegram display, creating readable mobile-friendly responses, or converting tables/lists to emoji format.</description>
    <location>/home/ubuntu/clawd/skills/ui-formatter/SKILL.md</location>
  </skill>
  <skill>
    <name>bird</name>
    <description>X/Twitter CLI for reading, searching, posting, and engagement via cookies.</description>
    <location>/home/ubuntu/.npm-global/lib/node_modules/clawdbot/skills/bird/SKILL.md</location>
  </skill>
  <skill>
    <name>bluebubbles</name>
    <description>Build or update the BlueBubbles external channel plugin for Clawdbot (extension package, REST send/probe, webhook inbound).</description>
    <location>/home/ubuntu/.npm-global/lib/node_modules/clawdbot/skills/bluebubbles/SKILL.md</location>
  </skill>
  <skill>
    <name>clawdhub</name>
    <description>Use the ClawdHub CLI to search, install, update, and publish agent skills from clawdhub.com. Use when you need to fetch new skills on the fly, sync installed skills to latest or a specific version, or publish new/updated skill folders with the npm-installed clawdhub CLI.</description>
    <location>/home/ubuntu/.npm-global/lib/node_modules/clawdbot/skills/clawdhub/SKILL.md</location>
  </skill>
  <skill>
    <name>github</name>
    <description>Interact with GitHub using the `gh` CLI. Use `gh issue`, `gh pr`, `gh run`, and `gh api` for issues, PRs, CI runs, and advanced queries.</description>
    <location>/home/ubuntu/.npm-global/lib/node_modules/clawdbot/skills/github/SKILL.md</location>
  </skill>
  <skill>
    <name>notion</name>
    <description>Notion API for creating and managing pages, databases, and blocks.</description>
    <location>/home/ubuntu/.npm-global/lib/node_modules/clawdbot/skills/notion/SKILL.md</location>
  </skill>
  <skill>
    <name>skill-creator</name>
    <description>Create or update AgentSkills. Use when designing, structuring, or packaging skills with scripts, references, and assets.</description>
    <location>/home/ubuntu/.npm-global/lib/node_modules/clawdbot/skills/skill-creator/SKILL.md</location>
  </skill>
  <skill>
    <name>slack</name>
    <description>Use when you need to control Slack from Clawdbot via the slack tool, including reacting to messages or pinning/unpinning items in Slack channels or DMs.</description>
    <location>/home/ubuntu/.npm-global/lib/node_modules/clawdbot/skills/slack/SKILL.md</location>
  </skill>
  <skill>
    <name>tmux</name>
    <description>Remote-control tmux sessions for interactive CLIs by sending keystrokes and scraping pane output.</description>
    <location>/home/ubuntu/.npm-global/lib/node_modules/clawdbot/skills/tmux/SKILL.md</location>
  </skill>
  <skill>
    <name>weather</name>
    <description>Get current weather and forecasts (no API key required).</description>
    <location>/home/ubuntu/.npm-global/lib/node_modules/clawdbot/skills/weather/SKILL.md</location>
  </skill>
</available_skills>

resolvedSkills.name: humanizer

resolvedSkills.name: mcporter

resolvedSkills.name: morning-brief

resolvedSkills.name: nano-banana-pro
resolvedSkills.description: Generate/edit images with Nano Banana Pro (Gemini 3 Pro Image). Use for image create/modify requests incl. edits. Supports text-to-image + image-to-image; 1K/2K/4K; use --input-image.

resolvedSkills.name: nano-pdf
resolvedSkills.description: Edit PDFs with natural-language instructions using the nano-pdf CLI.

resolvedSkills.name: personal-greeting
resolvedSkills.description: Context-aware personal greetings based on time of day, activity patterns, and tasks. Provides morning briefings with tasks and motivation, evening summaries with accomplishments, and weekend suggestions. Use for automated daily check-ins, motivation, and activity tracking integrated with task management.

resolvedSkills.name: prompt-log
resolvedSkills.description: Extract conversation transcripts from AI coding session logs (Clawdbot, Claude Code, Codex, Kimi). Use when asked to export prompt history, session logs, or transcripts from .jsonl session files.

resolvedSkills.name: self-improving
resolvedSkills.description: Capture errors, lessons learned, and feedback to build institutional knowledge that improves future performance. Use when mistakes happen, better approaches are discovered, user preferences are expressed, or when starting tasks similar to past work. Triggers include "remember this", "don't do X again", "that worked well", "lesson learned", or before starting complex/multi-step work.

resolvedSkills.name: steve-diagnostics
resolvedSkills.description: Steve's self-health check - response times, token usage, errors, session bloat. Use when debugging slow responses or checking system health.

resolvedSkills.name: sysadmin-toolbox
resolvedSkills.description: Ready-to-run shell one-liners for common sysadmin tasks including log analysis, process management, network diagnostics, security checks, and AWS CLI operations. resolvedSkills.name: task-master
